summary: This is a July 2, 2020 press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors from at least 1994 to 1997, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the allegations of grooming and abuse and announces her arrest in New Hampshire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement condemning Maxwell's alleged crimes and her role in facilitating abuse.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the New York Field Office of the FBI
persons.context: Made a statement praising the bravery of the victims and condemning Maxwell's and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement commending investigators and partners for seeking justice for survivors of sexual assault.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse.
Maxwell is alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor victims to be sexually abused by Epstein and herself.
Epstein is alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with Maxwell's assistance.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a federal indictment unsealed in Manhattan.

events.title: Period of Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse
events.description: The timeframe during which Maxwell and Epstein allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls as young as 14.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell allegedly made several false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New Hampshire (where Maxwell was presented in court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors.
The indictment alleges the abuse occurred from at least 1994 to 1997, with victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell is charged with enticing and transporting minors for illegal sex acts, and with two counts of perjury for false statements in 2016 depositions.
The alleged grooming and abuse took place at Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, and at Maxwell's London residence.
The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Alison J. Nathan.
